Thriller remake, starring Gene Hackman, Anne Archer, JT Walsh and James B Sikking

Sci-fi thriller based on Stephen King's novel, starring John Cusack and Samuel L Jackson

programme.desc: Four friends driving through the Australian outback are run off the road by a lorry, which they later find has no driver. When they then witness a murder, they get on board the truck to escape, only to find the vehicle has a mind of its own and a sinister destination planned for them - as well as a terrifying cargo on board. Horror, with Bob Morley and Sophie Lowe

programme.desc: The birth of a couple's first child goes from joyous to terrifying when they discover their daughter is surrounded by a horde of evil entities. Supernatural horror, starring Antonia Thomas, Luke Norris and Thea Petrie

Director Frank Sabatella's horror, starring Jay Jay Warren, Frank Whaley and Timothy Bottoms

Comedy horror, starring Corin Nemec, Yancy Butler and Robert Englund

It turns out she was a popular member of staff, a charismatic performer and great with the guests - but her mother's reaction to her death makes the detectives suspect there is more to her family situation than meets the eye. And when her colleagues' alibis for the night of the murder don't quite stack up, a different picture of the victim - and the camp - comes to light. Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with guest appearances from Pixie Lott, Lee Boardman, Lisa Riley and Andrea Lowe

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: As the Brokenwood Golf Club gathers for its Wednesday morning round, a zombie-like figure lurches from the morning mist identified as Alison Stone, the wealthy club owner. Her face red and blistering, she collapses into a bunker and dies leaving Mike and Kristin to investigate an apparent homicide by poisoning. Detective drama, starring Neill Rea, Fern Sutherland, Pana Hema Taylor and Nic Sampson

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: An investigation gets under way when a girl is left for dead at a boys' school fete. Mark Williams stars in this drama, based on the stories by GK Chesterton

programme.title: In the Dark
programme.desc: Helen and Paul are joined by pathologist friend Phil Hendricks as they become further embroiled in the abduction case. The clock is ticking to find Poppy alive and clear Bates's name, but to Paul's vexation, Helen seems increasingly disturbed by being in Polesford. Is she too distracted by pressing secrets past and present to keep her mind on the case? Crime drama, starring MyAnna Buring and Ben Batt

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: DI John Rebus investigates a murder that looks set to result in gang warfare, but his cynical inquiries come to an abrupt halt when his daughter Sammy is involved in a near-fatal hit-and-run incident - leading a vengeful Rebus on an obsessive trail that threatens to engulf him. Crime thriller, starring John Hannah and Eilidh MacDonald

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki is asked to give evidence at the appeal of convicted murderer David Bennetto, and when her testimony leads to his release, she ends up locking horns with DI Rachel Klein, who put the man away six years earlier. It seems the detective is right when another young man is found dead at the scene of the original crime. Has Nikki helped to free a serial killer? Emilia Fox stars, with appearances from Tobias Menzies, Michael Socha and Aaron McCusker

programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Ria Lina joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas host the live magazine programme featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Coronation fever sweeps across the square, Billy makes it his mission to convince Linda to host a party at The Vic and comes up with a way to include Mick in the celebrations. Reiss finds out why Sonia is fed up of him

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Bez, Motsi Mabuse, Shazia Mirza and Steve Pemberton join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The fourth quarter-final sees the week's most talented four cooks return to fight for a place in Knockout Week. They must cook two courses that will excite not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also 2020 champion Thomas Frake, 2010 champion Dhruv Baker and 2021 finalist Alexina Anatole. All three of their forerunners have gone on to forge careers in the food industry

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Gordon celebrates the very best of British - exquisite produce and the pinnacle of fine dining. First, he invites his entrepreneurs to the Fish Society in Surrey where he tasks them with perfectly de-shelling one of the most expensive foods to be found on any menu - lobster. He then puts the contenders in charge of his high-end Mayfair restaurant, Lucky Cat. With his reputation on the line and paying diners expecting immaculate food and service, he expects them to live up to his own extraordinarily high standards in order to have any hope of proceeding in the competition

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from Telford, Shropshire. On the panel are Transport Secretary Mark Harper MP, Shadow Foreign Secretary David Lammy MP, President of the National Farmers Union Minette Batters, journalist and author Peter Hitchens and the musician Billy Bragg

programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. Mayoral elections are also taking place in Bedford, Leicester, Mansfield and Middlesbrough. Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens and Professor John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. The BBC's Political Editor Chris Mason analyses what these elections mean for each political party, and senior politicians are on hand to give their verdict on the results

programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. Mayoral elections are also taking place in Bedford, Leicester, Mansfield and Middlesbrough. Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens and Professor John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. The BBC's Political Editor Chris Mason analyses what these elections mean for each political party, and senior politicians are on hand to give their verdict on the results

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones co-hosts the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and YouTuber Jim Browning join forces with ethical hackers to hunt down cyber criminals. Using the same remote-access technology that criminals use to scam their victims, the team hacks the hackers and monitors their operation

programme.title: Maximum Security
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood finds out how security works at a Premiership rugby match, and hears about an award-winning act of bravery by a hospital security team

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is in Wolverhampton to look around a traditional three-bed semi-detached house on a generous corner plot, before heading to Stoke-on-Trent to see a three-in-one auction lot of two flats with a ground-floor shop included. In Dover, Kent, Martin Roberts employs a simple but ingenious device to confirm whether the floors in a three-bed Victorian mid-terrace are uneven

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion hosts a special Coronation episode at Newark Antiques fair, Nottinghamshire, in which the red and blue teams are made up of royal fans, guided by experts Raj Bisram and Roo Irvine. The teams have 300 to spend on three items and royal themed-antiques are very much on their shopping lists. Christina also visits a pottery for an exclusive look at some new commemorative ware, and she makes her own royal plate fit for a king

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Jo Coburn leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. David Wallace Lockhart crunches the numbers on his giant screen, and Professor John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: HM The King's Coronation: The Eve of the Coronation
programme.desc: Kirsty Young is joined by a range of guests who give personal insights into the King and Queen Consort as they look ahead to the coronation. Sophie Raworth joins from outside Westminster Abbey, while JJ Chalmers speaks to members of the armed forces as they prepare for one of the biggest military parades in British living memory

programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts, as comedian Maisie Adam and journalist Helen Lewis join in the fun on the satirical current affairs quiz, alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: Ordinary frontline police community support officers Dom and Kay are tasked to infiltrate a predominantly black gang of villains. Working undercover, the pair are unwittingly thrust into the murky world of deep cover infiltration as they pose as disgruntled former officers within a powerful criminal enterprise, with the motiviations of the DI who sent them in becoming increasingly unclear. Matters take an unexpected turn when the duo are tasked by a gang member with carrying out a grisly task that throws the mission - and their lives - into chaos. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Guardians of the Galaxy (2014)
programme.desc: A boy abducted by aliens grows up to be an interstellar mercenary. He and a band of misfits break out of a prison space station with a plan to sell a mysterious orb to the highest bidder - but cross a warlord, who intends to turn it into a powerful weapon. Sci-fi adventure, starring Chris Pratt, Zoe Saldana and Dave Bautista, with the voices of Bradley Cooper and Vin Diesel

programme.title: NBA Live
programme.desc: Philadelphia 76ers v Boston Celtics (Tip-off 12.30am). Live coverage of game three of the Eastern Conference semi-final, which takes place at Wells Fargo Centre

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Naga Munchetty and Charlie Stayt present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents the run-up to the historic occasion from a studio outside Buckingham Palace, where she is joined by a range of guests including friends and colleagues of the royal couple. Throughout the morning, a series of films explore the King's passions, while across the capital a team of presenters are in key locations to report and commentate on the day as events unfold. JJ Chalmers speaks to the men and women of the armed forces as they take their positions, Anita Rani meets members of the public and Sophie Raworth is outside Westminster Abbey

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents live coverage of the historic event as crowds gather to celebrate the Coronation of Charles III and the Queen Consort. Viewers will have a front-row seat of the King's Procession makes it way through the streets of London, from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Abbey, where Sophie Raworth speaks to guests as they arrive and Huw Edwards provides commentary on the ancient ceremony itself

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: The pageantry continues as the newly crowned King Charles and Queen Camilla head back to Buckingham Palace in the Coronation Procession, where they are received at the Mall and make their traditional balcony appearance. Presented by Sophie Raworth, with commentary by Huw Edwards

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Tangled (2010)
programme.desc: A baby princess's hair has mystical powers, so an evil witch kidnaps her and locks her in a tower, hoping to use the magic to fend off old age. When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight. Disney animated comedy based on the Rapunzel story, with the voices of Mandy Moore and Zachary Levi

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Steven Fletcher and Kirsten Ramsay restore a 19th-century clock, George Blackman rebuilds a broken typewriter and Suzie Fletcher repairs a Second World War pilot's bomber jacket

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Live from outside Buckingham Palace, Kirsty Young looks back at choice moments of the King's Coronation, following the procession to Westminster Abbey, the ceremony and the return journey to Buckingham Palace where the newly crowned monarchs greeted the crowds

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: When a patient enters the emergency department and is found to have a grenade in his possession, a dangerous situation unfolds that threatens the lives of patients and staff. As the hospital is evacuated, Faith takes desperate measures to try to get hold of more pills, and Cam proves he can keep his cool in a crisis as he sets up a temporary treatment unit in the car park

programme.title: Magpie Murders
programme.desc: Susan finds herself under increasing pressure from Charles, who tells her that he has approached someone else for the CEO job at Clover Books. Meanwhile, Atticus Pnd is confident that he has at last discovered the identity of the Saxby on Avon murderer

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Leeds United at Etihad Stadium and Tottenham Hotspur v Crystal Palace at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. City will have expected to move closer to another title when they entertained struggling Leeds, while Spurs aimed to get their stuttering top-four bid back on track against Roy Hodgson's rejuvenated side. Plus, Bournemouth v Chelsea, Liverpool v Brentford and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Aston Villa

programme.title: Match of the Day Top 10
programme.desc: Gary Lineker, Micah Richards and Alan Shearer count down the best Spanish players to have played in the Premier League

programme.title: The Producers (1968)
programme.desc: A crooked Broadway producer and his neurotic accountant discover they can make a fortune by putting on a play that closes on opening night, then pocketing the unspent budget. The duo set out to put on the worst show of all time - a tasteless little number called Springtime for Hitler written by a deranged former Nazi. Mel Brooks' comedy, starring Zero Mostel, Gene Wilder and Kenneth Mars

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Presenter Christina Trevanion and experts Catherine Southon and Kate Bliss go antique hunting in Peterborough, Cambridgeshire, before heading to Lichfield in Staffordshire for today's auction. Christina discovers the history of the humble jigsaw and takes a closer look at a huge collection of puzzles

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive travels to the heart of Sicily to cook lunch in a community kitchen set up by Jamie Oliver's former restaurant manager and spends the night in a 700-year-old mansion. He also meets people from around the world who have bought homes in the one Euro house hub of Mussomeli and discovers arguably Italy's best street food in the island's capital Palermo

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara Cox is joined by comedian Sara Pascoe, comedy actor and writer Charlie Higson, singer-songwriter Katie Melua and actor and dancer Adam Garcia, who champion their favourite books. The guests also review this week's two book club choices, which are Strange Sally Diamond by Liz Nugent, and The Summer Book by Tove Jansson

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A homeowner makes an alarming discovery after hearing a bump in the night. A parrot owner is left spitting feathers when his beloved bird is stolen, and a doorbell camera solves the puzzle of a missing monkey-puzzle tree. Presented by Dominic Littlewood

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: My Million Pound Menu
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix welcomes another two food companies to Manchester, where the owners pitch their businesses to high-street investors in the hope of opening their own restaurants. Up this week are Hollings, which specialises in British chophouse classics, and the Cheese Wheel, an Italian-inspired brand serving fresh pasta direct from a cheese wheel

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Life in the tropical Atlantic, where everything from dolphins, manatees and whale sharks to sunbathing jellyfish thrive in the Caribbean's warm, sheltered waters, fringed by coral reefs and rich mangrove forests. But when extreme heat in Africa unleashes terrifying hurricanes, all hell breaks loose across the region

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The amateur sewers take part in reduce, reuse and recycle week, in which none of the fabric in the haberdashery is new. They begin by creating a quilted patchwork jacket with a load of old scraps from past Sewing Bees, then breathe new life into boring old coats by completely deconstructing them and reconstructing them into brand new stylish outerwear. In the made-to-measure challenge, the sewers must fit a maxi dress to a model using an unwanted duvet cover

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: David Harper and Adam Partridge search for items to sell at auction at Penrhyn Castle in north Wales. Paul Martin uncovers the story of Britain's longest-running industrial strike

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Matt Edmondson, Sabrina Grant, Andy Hamilton and Kirsty Wark test their general knowledge skills ahead of Friday's final. Richard Osman hosts

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: The newsreader explores the coastline around Mount Vesuvius, famous for the ruins of Pompeii. He unearths why volcanic soil makes for the tastiest fruit and vegetables, learns to make Italian marmalade, uncovers the surprising royal tale behind Italy's first trainline and tries his hand at carving jewellery from coral found deep beneath the sea

programme.title: Amol Rajan Interviews
programme.desc: Amol Rajan joins Richard Branson on one of his cruise ships in Miami to discuss his life, loves, passions and challenges. In a sometimes uncomfortable interview with rarely seen archive footage, Rajan delves into Branson's background to discover how he went from 1960s hippy to global business icon, re-shaping multiple industries and ending up in space

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Lochs
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores the lochs and mountains of Wester Ross and discovers that the loch-side communities were only finally connected by road in the 1970s. Paul borrows a bike and cycles over the infamous Bealach na B - one of Britain's highest and steepest mountain passes - before reliving the glory days of the Kishorn oil rig fabrication yard, which in the 1970s built the world's biggest movable structure

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: A mum thanks the fundraisers who helped her little girl to walk when doctors said that may never happen. And a man meets the woman who raised a life-changing guide dog. Alex Jones presents

programme.title: Guilt
programme.desc: On the run and out of luck in the Highlands, Max and Jake resort to desperate measures to hide from Maggie as they turn to their estranged father Alec for sanctuary, but Teddy pays a visit to Kenny and demands to know where the brothers are. With the Lynch family finances frozen, Maggie spots an opportunity in the sale of National Bank of Caledonia, much to Sir Jim Sturrock's surprise

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Gareth is definitely going to be working from home today, in case anything unlucky happens, because it just happens to be Friday the 13th. Comedy drama written by and starring Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, with Amanda Abbington and Samantha Spiro

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Nadiya: Anxiety and Me
programme.desc: Since Nadiya Hussain won The Great British Bake Off in 2015, she's rarely been off TV screens. But behind the scenes Nadiya suffers from extreme anxiety and debilitating panic attacks, which she's had since childhood. For decades, she has kept her anxiety a secret, ashamed to speak out. Now, she sets out to find the cause of her anxiety, exploring the most effective, available treatments, while also having therapy herself, in the hope of managing her anxiety

programme.title: Sus (2010)
programme.desc: A black man is taken in for questioning when his wife is found murdered on the night of the 1979 general election. He comes to realise that the police have already assumed he killed her, while the racist detectives interrogating him use increasingly brutal methods to force him into a false confession. Drama, with Clint Dyer, Ralph Brown, Rafe Spall and Anjela Lauren Smith

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders
programme.desc: The NYPD investigates multiple leads regarding the murder of Nick De Noia, with possible motives including a love triangle, insurance fraud, or an angry boss - all of which lead nowhere. Years later, the FBI receives a tip from a hitman known as Strawberry, which blows the case wide open

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders
programme.desc: The FBI teams up with down-and-out actor Ray Colon, who leads federal agents on an international manhunt for the person behind Nick De Noia's murder. However, even after the mystery is solved and the killer is behind bars, the story is far from over, with a shocking death and the discovery of tens of millions of dollars secretly hidden in Switzerland

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Shepton Mallet, Somerset, and challenges collectors to identify a mystery item connected to a local industry. With Kate Bliss and Colin Young

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: The newsreader explores the coastline around Mount Vesusius, famous for the ruins of Pompeii. He unearths why volcanic soil makes for the tastiest fruit and vegetables, learns to make Italian marmalade, uncovers the surprising royal tale behind Italy's first trainline and tries his hand at carving jewellery from coral found deep beneath the sea

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don adds some interest to the spring garden. He also sows peas and shallots, has some thrifty tips for petunias, and plants lilies in pots. Carol Klein visits Mothecombe Gardens in Devon, which has been designed specifically for pollinators. Arit Anderson joins a group of young carers at a community garden in West Sussex, where they go for respite, friendship and fun

programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Ongoing coverage of local elections in England

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Jo Coburn is your guide as the votes are counted in 2023's bumper set of elections. BBC correspondents will be at all the key counts around the country. David Wallace Lockhart will crunch the numbers on his giant screen, and Professor John Curtice will assess the underlying electoral trends. Senior politicians and commentators will be on hand to give their verdict on the results

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the remaining 17 contestants to compete for a possible 10,000 jackpot. Right answers take them closer to the big money, but if at any stage they give an Impossible answer, they will immediately be knocked out. Quiz, hosted by Rick Edwards

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: John Craven files his final report from the Malvern Hills and celebrates the survival warriors of British nature that are staging a fightback. Jules Hudson is just up the road in Herefordshire with his dog Teddy to sniff out the spring dangers lurking outdoors and in homes that could harm pets

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley is in the Shropshire countryside to help a couple who have 425,000 to invest in a character home that gives them space for entertaining and their beloved jukebox. Away from the house search, Ginny visits the Royal Air Force Museum Cosford and meets the conservation team reconstructing a rare Hampden bomber which played an important role in the skies during the Second World War

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: It's children's week in the sewing room and Sara Pascoe invites the contestants to create a cute sailor suit for a toddler, which requires them to make elasticated shorts and a top with a square collar and ties. For the Transformation Challenge, the contestants turn old school clothes into a cool outfit to be seen in out on the streets, and things get scary when mini-models enter the sewing room for a made-to-measure challenge with a Halloween theme

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Live coverage of the opening meeting of the series, which comes from Khalifa International Stadium in Qatar. There were two meeting records here last year, with Swedish pole vault star Armand Duplantis clearing 6.02m, and Gabrielle Thomas clocking 21.98 seconds in the 200m to equal the time set by her American compatriot Allyson Felix seven years earlier

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive visits his favourite tourist spot of the Amalfi Coast, going inland to a mozzarella factory, before hopping across to the island of Capri, where he makes his wife a pair of the local sandals made famous by Jackie Kennedy. He also spends the evening singing folk songs at a nightclub favoured by celebrities including Beyonce and Jay-Z

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Mediterranean Adventure
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers discover the culinary delights of Corsica, starting out in a delicatessen to get a taste of the local cuisine, including the figatelli sausage. The owner explains how most of the island's food is made up of a holy trinity of ingredients - meat, cheese and chestnuts, a list that forms the basis of the bikers' exploration

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: There's a slight royal theme to the work going ahead of the Coronation weekend. with Carole Baxter and Calum Clunie planting delphiniums, reportedly one of the favourite flowers of the King. Carole also starts to refresh the planting in the Garden for Wildlife with a selection of varieties known to help pollinators and other species, while Calum replants some of his roses that didn't do so well at the end of last year. Brian Cunningham reports on the work he's doing at his own garden in Perthshire, and there is the next instalment in the programme's Back to Basics skills guide

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost visits a walled garden in Somerset to meet volunteers who are gardening alongside those who need help to transform their lives. At Longmeadow, Monty Don creates two different planting schemes for pots for shady spaces, transplants grasses in the jewel garden and plants out his favourite varieties of tomatoes. And Rachel de Thame revels in the seasonal displays of Azaleas in Shropshire

programme.title: Wrexham: Hollywood or Bust!
programme.desc: Wrexham AFC are one of the oldest football clubs in the world, with a home in the Racecourse Ground that dates back virtually to the dawn of the sport. Theirs is a history that stretches back further than most, with drama and memorable moments to rival any club. This documentary recounts that history, while revealing why promotion to the Football League under Hollywood-based owners Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney would mean so much to the club's fans

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Faisal Islam

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and the team reveal more of the lifestyle and culture that surrounds the Premier League and those involved in it

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: Ash and Gordon's awkward sexual encounter causes them to drift apart. Comedy, starring Patrick Brammall and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary charting the last five years of the life of cancer campaigner Deborah James, a former deputy head teacher who amassed a huge social media following through her online persona Bowelbabe. She talks frankly about her diagnosis with bowel cancer and the treatment she received, revealing what the reality of living with bowel cancer was like for her and those closest to her. The film features mobile-phone footage, Deborah's collection of TikTok videos, Instagram posts, You Me and the Big C podcasts, family videos and Deborah's voice notes

programme.title: Get on Up: The Triumph of Black America
programme.desc: David Harewood takes viewers from the birth of hip-hop in the early 1980s to the present day. He explores how a new generation of producers and performers increasingly began to own their 'creative capital', and became billionaires with lifestyles to match. David also examines the influence of hip-hop on 90s film with director Allen Hughes, and meets Black Panther star Florence Kasumba

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers each have two days, a painter, a carpenter and 1,000 to transform a 1930s beach chalet to fit their different briefs. Peter is determined to put being in the bottom four behind him with a big and bold design for his family bolthole chalet and Tom supresses his instincts for cosy chic as he takes on a Caribbean-themed shack. Monika steps out of her usual gothic comfort zone to design a home for a group of friends called The Gin Club and Temi takes on a different approach for her eco-chalet. Jack takes his brief for a team building space for A&E staff as an opportunity to give back to the NHS staff that saved his life. Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen joins as a guest judge

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining hopefuls serve up the two courses they hope will see them through to knockout week. John Torode and Gregg Wallace taste their efforts, as well as three previous champions - -Thomasina Miers (2005), Kenny Tutt (2018) and Saliha Mahmood-Ahmed (2017). With just two places up for grabs, the amateurs need to show real flair and ambition to edge closer to this year's trophy

programme.desc: Timmy decides to help the hedghogs find a resting place for the night. His efforts, however, lead his friends into a series a scrapes rather than giving them a good night's sleep

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: JJ is convinced that Mrs Creecher is secretly a master of Blamjitsu, so she ersuades the gang to help trick her into revealing her blam credentials

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents the run-up to the historic occasion from a studio outside Buckingham Palace, where she is joined by a range of guests including friends and colleagues of the royal couple. Throughout the morning, a series of films explore the King's passions, while across the capital a team of presenters are in key locations to report and commentate on the day as events unfold. JJ Chalmers speaks to the men and women of the armed forces as they take their positions, Anita Rani meets members of the public and Sophie Raworth is outside Westminster Abbey

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents live coverage of the historic event as crowds gather to celebrate the Coronation of Charles III and the Queen Consort. Viewers will have a front-row seat of the King's Procession makes it way through the streets of London, from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Abbey, where Sophie Raworth speaks to guests as they arrive and Huw Edwards provides commentary on the ancient ceremony itself

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: The pageantry continues as the newly crowned King Charles and Queen Camilla head back to Buckingham Palace in the Coronation Procession, where they are received at the Mall and make their traditional balcony appearance. Presented by Sophie Raworth, with commentary by Huw Edwards

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Documentary charting life along the Zambezi River, set against the spectacular backdrop of the Victoria Falls, and told through the experiences of local angler Mr White, who has fished the waters for 69 years. Over the decades, his companions have been the area's wildlife - elephants, baboons, hippos and kingfishers - and the film shows how their lives are ruled by the seasonal changes of the river and the rains

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents the show from London Zoo in Regent's Park, with Will Axon and Thomas Plant doing their valuations al fresco

programme.title: Pride & Prejudice (2005)
programme.desc: Elizabeth Bennet is one of five sisters whose mother is determined to find them suitable husbands. The arrival of a wealthy gentleman and his friends at a nearby mansion leads to an introduction between Elizabeth and the aloof Mr Darcy, to whom she takes an instant dislike. However, an unexpected attraction eventually develops. Period drama based on Jane Austen's novel, starring Keira Knightley, Matthew Macfadyen and Judi Dench

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Matt Edmondson, Sabrina Grant, Andy Hamilton and Kirsty Wark keep their eyes on the prize before Richard Osman announces the week's winner

programme.title: Edward Scissorhands (1990)
programme.desc: A reclusive genius creates a boy but dies before completing him, leaving his brainchild with scissor-like blades in place of hands. A kindly woman from a nearby suburb takes pity on the lonely figure and welcomes him into her home. He quickly becomes a hit in the neighbourhood - but then his new friends start to turn against him. Tim Burton's fantasy, starring Johnny Depp, Winona Ryder, Dianne Wiest and Vincent Price

programme.title: Lionel Richie at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances by the singer, including his first Top of the Pops appearance with the Commodores in 1979 and highlights from his 2009 concert at the BBC's Maida Vale studios

programme.title: Sounds of Liverpool at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of performances from the archives of some of Merseyside's biggest and best-loved musical stars to mark its hosting of the Eurovision Song Contest, including The Story of the Blues by Wah!, You'll Never Walk Alone by Gerry and the Pacemakers and Two Tribes by Frankie Goes to Hollywood

programme.title: ABBA at the BBC
programme.desc: A collection of memorable performances by the group. Agnetha Faltskog, Bjorn Ulvaeus, Benny Andersson and Anni-Frid Lyngstad were thrust into the limelight in 1974 when Waterloo triumphed at the Eurovision Song Contest in Brighton, marking the start of their rise to fame. Various outings were captured by BBC cameras over the next few years and several are featured here alongside their Top of the Pops debut, archive interviews and footage featuring hits including Waterloo, Dancing Queen, Does Your Mother Know, Thank You for the Music, SOS, Fernando and Chiquitita. There is also a chance to see the foursome on a 1982 edition of Noel Edmonds' Late, Late Breakfast Show, which was ABBA's last televised appearance in the UK

programme.title: The Joy of ABBA
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how the pop group raised the bar for their music genre in the 1970s and early '80s, popularising the sound of Swedish melancholy. The programme explores how the quartet of Agnetha Faltskog, Bjorn Ulvaeus, Benny Andersson and Anni-Frid Lyngstad came to dominate the British music charts with simple, catchy melodies, but also divided opinion due to the populist sheen of their output

programme.title: La Belle Epoque (2019)
programme.desc: A man in a failing marriage discovers a company that create perfect re-creations of historical periods. He employs them to replicate the week when he first met his wife, 40 years previously, in the hope that it will help him reconnect with her in the present, but instead is drawn into an affair with the actress playing her. Romantic comedy, starring Daniel Auteuil and Fanny Ardant. In French, English and German

programme.title: Coronation Tailors: Fit for a King
programme.desc: Menswear designer and Sewing Bee judge Patrick Grant takes viewers behind the scenes at uniform manufacturers Kashket & Partners as they pull out all the stops to prepare thousands of parade uniforms for King Charles' Coronation. The film reveals the rich heritage and history behind Britain's military uniforms and the stories of the men and women of the armed services who will wear them with pride

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's rail exploration of South-east Asia continues in Malaysia, along the way learning how rubber engineering ensures railway passengers enjoy a smooth ride

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: On the last leg of his journey across the North and the Midlands, Robbie faces issues with ice on the Grand Union Canal. He takes on Foxton's famous lock flight in Leicestershire and completes his journey in the picturesque village Braunston, Northamptonshire, regarded as the spiritual home for narrowboaters

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Avid trainspotter Michael Palin fulfils a boyhood dream as he travels from Euston in London to Kyle of Lochalsh in Scotland. Part of The Golden Age of Steam season

programme.title: A Fish Called Wanda (1988)
programme.desc: A stuffy English barrister representing a jewel thief is targeted by his client's partners in crime - a seductive American crook and her dim-witted would-be philosopher lover who will go to any lengths to discover where the diamonds from their last heist have been hidden. Crime comedy, starring John Cleese, Jamie Lee Curtis, Kevin Kline, Michael Palin and Tom Georgeson

programme.title: Blue Murder at St Trinian's (1957)
programme.desc: The mischievous schoolgirls travel by coach to Europe, accompanied by a wanted jewel thief dressed as a woman, and an undercover police detective. Comedy, starring Lionel Jeffries, Joyce Grenfell, Terry-Thomas, George Cole and Alistair Sim

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Interviews with British comedy stars of the silver screen, featuring the likes of George Formby, Peter Sellers and the Monty Python team. Narrated by Sylvia Syms

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's rail exploration of South-east Asia continues in Malaysia, along the way learning how rubber engineering ensures railway passengers enjoy a smooth ride

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Noel Edmonds presents an edition from May 5, 1977, a week that saw Deniece Williams top the chart for the first time with her single Free. The show also features performances by Joy Sarney, Rod Stewart, Frankie Valli, Bay City Rollers, Mac & Katie Kissoon, Mr Big, Leo Sayer, Delegation and Tavares

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mike Read and Steve Wright host the May 3, 1984 show, featuring OMD, Blancmange, New Order, Kenny Loggins, Jocelyn Brown, the Human League and Duran Duran

programme.title: Fanny: The Right to Rock
programme.desc: The story of critically acclaimed 1970s all-woman Filipino rock group Fanny, who despite critical acclaim and regular tours with bands including Chicago, Steely Dan and Slade, faced both sexism and racism. Now as they re-form to record a new album in their seventies, they challenge the stigma of ageism as well. With contributions from Bonnie Raitt, Todd Rundgren, the Runaways' Cherie Currie, Lovin' Spoonful's John Sebastien, Def Leppard's Joe Elliott, David Bowie's guitarist Earl Slick and bassist Gail Ann Dorsey, and Steely Dan's Jeff 'Skunk' Baxter

programme.title: Girls in Bands at the BBC
programme.desc: Compilation of performances by some of the best female musicians in rock, from the 1970s to the present day. Artists featured include American rock group Fanny, the powerful vocals of Elkie Brooks on Vinegar Joe's Proud to Be a Honky Tonk Woman, the poetry of Patti Smith's Horses and upbeat energy of the Go-Go's on We Got the Beat

programme.desc: Richard Macer infiltrates morris dancing's endangered world of bells, beer and beards, discovering that women may be the unlikely saviours of this ancient masculine tradition

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc: Michael reaches the city of Timbuktu, along with a camel train carrying the giant salt blocks that made the city one of the greatest centres of Islamic learning. Later, Michael finally gets to grips with the heart and soul of the desert

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The adventurer continues his journey, travelling from K2 in Pakistan to Ladakh in India, a relatively short distance geographically, but one that will take a considerable feat of logistics owing to the region's politics. He passes through the Sikh city of Amritsar, spends time on a houseboat on Lake Dal, discovers his previous incarnations at the Astrological Institute, then travels on to an appointment with the Dalai Lama

programme.title: Homeward (2019)
programme.desc: Mustafa, a Crimean Tatar, and his son Alim transport the body of Mustafa's other son, a soldier killed in combat, from Kyiv to Crimea to give him a proper burial. Drama, starring Akhtem Seitablaev and Remzi Bilyalov. In Crimean Tatar, Ukrainian and Russian

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc: Michael Palin and Terry Jones wrote this classic comedy, in which Palin stars as a soccer fan whose obsession with the world's worst team causes misery for both him and his long-suffering family. With Gwen Taylor and Bill Fraser. First shown in 1979

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc: Youngster Roger Bartlesham experiences a sexual awakening in colonial India, but the emotional turmoil leads him to commit a deplorable act. Final episode of the comedy series, starring Michael Palin, Richard Vernon, John Le Mesurier and Joan Sanderson. First shown in 1979

programme.desc: Bob has doubts about his marriage when he realises all his peers - even the vicar - seem to be getting divorced. Classic comedy, starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc: Dr Helen Czerski tells the story of scientific endeavour, revealing the secrets of the universe as she takes to the skies in a jumbo jet, equipped with an infra-red telescope. She explores how the birds and the bees, who can see ultraviolet, view the world, and looks at how x-rays can be used to harness colours and image the human body as never before, thereby opening up new ways to treat disease

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The actor embarks on the last leg of his journey, passing through the dramatic mountains of the Hoggar Massif, visiting Libya and crossing into Tunisia, where he relives the filming of The Life of Brian. He also visits Algiers and the Spanish enclave of Ceuta before finishing the expedition where he started - Gibraltar

programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: Chelcea's biggest passion is for hair! In this documentary, she shows us how she does her hair at home, doing her own hair, her mum's hair, her sister's hair, her friend's hair and even her dad's beard. Shemhas been doing lots of different hairstyles for everyone, inlcuding twists, braids (thick and small), plaits, tops buns, and also leaving it out as an afro, which is really good for the hair and scalp. Chelcea is an expert on the science of hair and how to look after it, and is particularity interested in natural hair remedies. Chelcea's parents encourage their daughter's passion and, through beautiful animation, we learn about her mum's childhood in the Democratic Republic of Congo. By taking us on her own hair journey, Chelcea's determination to inspire others to celebrate their amazing hair shines through!

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Febo's family are from America, where they celebrate Thanksgiving. As it is traditional on Thanksgiving to prepare and serve pumpkin pie as a dessert, Febo is making this for his friends. He starts by making a pastry case and fitting it into a pie dish. For the pumpkin filling: he pours melted butter and buttermilk into a bowl of brown sugar, along with whisked egg, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, allspice and cloves. Febo adds his special ingredient, pumpkin puree, and then mixes them all together. When it's mixed, he spoons it into the empty pastry case and puts it in the oven to cook. Febo's friends all help to decorate his American-themed table before they taste his pumpkin pie.

Alice decides to play a prank on James, which the kids at Kids Club think is hilarious, especially Magnus. Soon, James is plotting his revenge and gets his own back on Alice. Before long, theres a prank-off underway. As the jokes continue, Magnus gets caught up in the excitement. But, when he decides to play his own prank, he accidentally takes it too far and upsets Suki. At first they dont believe him, but after sneakily quizzing Dad, they realise that Kipper is right and start preparing for the princesss arrival. Even though its a secret, they tell Anneena, and she tells Mrs Patel, who is so excited she rushes home, bakes a cake and returns in her best clothes. Meanwhile, the children get everything ready. They put on their best outfits, practise their royal greetings and decorate the house so that its fit for the queen. Suddenly the doorbell rings - the princess has arrived! programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens and Professor John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. The BBC's Political Editor Chris Mason analyses what these elections mean for each political party, and senior politicians are on hand to give their verdict on the results

programme.desc: Kirsty Young is joined by a range of guests who give personal insights into the King and Queen Consort as they look ahead to the coronation. Sophie Raworth joins from outside Westminster Abbey, while JJ Chalmers speaks to members of the armed forces as they prepare for one of the biggest military parades in British living memory

programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

programme.title: Wrexham: Hollywood or Bust!
programme.desc: Wrexham AFC are one of the oldest football clubs in the world, with a home in the Racecourse Ground that dates back virtually to the dawn of the sport. Theirs is a history that stretches back further than most, with drama and memorable moments to rival any club. This documentary recounts that history, while revealing why recently earned promotion to the Football League under Hollywood-based owners Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney means so much to the club's fans

programme.desc: Ordinary frontline police community support officers Dom and Kay are tasked to infiltrate a predominantly black gang of villains. Working undercover, the pair are unwittingly thrust into the murky world of deep cover infiltration as they pose as disgruntled former officers within a powerful criminal enterprise, with the motiviations of the DI who sent them in becoming increasingly unclear. Matters take an unexpected turn when the duo are tasked by a gang member with carrying out a grisly task that throws the mission - and their lives - into chaos. programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents live coverage of the historic event as crowds gather to celebrate the Coronation of Charles III and the Queen Consort. Viewers will have a front-row seat of the King's Procession makes it way through the streets of London, from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Abbey, where Sophie Raworth speaks to guests as they arrive and Huw Edwards provides commentary on the ancient ceremony itself

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: The pageantry continues as the newly crowned King Charles and Queen Camilla head back to Buckingham Palace in the Coronation Procession, where they are received at the Mall and make their traditional balcony appearance. Presented by Sophie Raworth, with commentary by Huw Edwards

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Tangled (2010)
programme.desc: A baby princess's hair has mystical powers, so an evil witch kidnaps her and locks her in a tower, hoping to use the magic to fend off old age. When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight. Disney animated comedy based on the Rapunzel story, with the voices of Mandy Moore and Zachary Levi

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.title: Wrexham: Hollywood or Bust!
programme.desc: Wrexham AFC are one of the oldest football clubs in the world, with a home in the Racecourse Ground that dates back virtually to the dawn of the sport. Theirs is a history that stretches back further than most, with drama and memorable moments to rival any club. This documentary recounts that history, while revealing why promotion to the Football League under Hollywood-based owners Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney would mean so much to the club's fans

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Live from outside Buckingham Palace, Kirsty Young looks back at choice moments of the King's Coronation, following the procession to Westminster Abbey, the ceremony and the return journey to Buckingham Palace where the newly crowned monarchs greeted the crowds

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: When a patient enters the emergency department and is found to have a grenade in his possession, a dangerous situation unfolds that threatens the lives of patients and staff. As the hospital is evacuated, Faith takes desperate measures to try to get hold of more pills, and Cam proves he can keep his cool in a crisis as he sets up a temporary treatment unit in the car park

programme.title: Magpie Murders
programme.desc: Susan finds herself under increasing pressure from Charles, who tells her that he has approached someone else for the CEO job at Clover Books. Meanwhile, Atticus Pnd is confident that he has at last discovered the identity of the Saxby on Avon murderer

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Leeds United at Etihad Stadium and Tottenham Hotspur v Crystal Palace at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. Mel Brooks' comedy, starring Zero Mostel, Gene Wilder and Kenneth Mars

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: After 25 years living in America, a couple are heading back to Blighty and have chosen Cornwall for their homecoming. Sonali Shah is on hand to show them some of the best property available in the county for their 675,000 budget

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Five dealers bid against each other for items brought in by the public, including a unique 1960s vase, a curious mirror, two chalkware statues and a troll called Trotter. Presented by Nigel Havers

programme.title: Unbeatable

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas host the live magazine programme featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Coronation fever sweeps across the square, Billy makes it his mission to convince Linda to host a party at The Vic and comes up with a way to include Mick in the celebrations. Reiss finds out why Sonia is fed up of him

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Bez, Motsi Mabuse, Shazia Mirza and Steve Pemberton join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The fourth quarter-final sees the week's most talented four cooks return to fight for a place in Knockout Week. They must cook two courses that will excite not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also 2020 champion Thomas Frake, 2010 champion Dhruv Baker and 2021 finalist Alexina Anatole. All three of their forerunners have gone on to forge careers in the food industry

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Gordon celebrates the very best of British - exquisite produce and the pinnacle of fine dining. First, he invites his entrepreneurs to the Fish Society in Surrey where he tasks them with perfectly de-shelling one of the most expensive foods to be found on any menu - lobster. He then puts the contenders in charge of his high-end Mayfair restaurant, Lucky Cat. With his reputation on the line and paying diners expecting immaculate food and service, he expects them to live up to his own extraordinarily high standards in order to have any hope of proceeding in the competition

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from Telford, Shropshire. On the panel are Transport Secretary Mark Harper MP, Shadow Foreign Secretary David Lammy MP, President of the National Farmers Union Minette Batters, journalist and author Peter Hitchens and the musician Billy Bragg

programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. Mayoral elections are also taking place in Bedford, Leicester, Mansfield and Middlesbrough. Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens and Professor John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. The BBC's Political Editor Chris Mason analyses what these elections mean for each political party, and senior politicians are on hand to give their verdict on the results

programme.title: HM The King's Coronation: The Eve of the Coronation
programme.desc: Kirsty Young is joined by a range of guests who give personal insights into the King and Queen Consort as they look ahead to the coronation. Sophie Raworth joins from outside Westminster Abbey, while JJ Chalmers speaks to members of the armed forces as they prepare for one of the biggest military parades in British living memory

programme.title: Sing for the King: The Search for the Coronation Choir
programme.desc: Gareth Malone, Motsi Mabuse, Amanda Holden and Rose Ayling-Ellis draw on their individual areas of expertise to coach, challenge and inspire singers to give a pitch-perfect performance and overcome the inevitable nerves that come with performing in front of royalty at Windsor Castle. A special choir made up of singing groups of all shapes and sizes to give a true representation of the diverse range of faces, places and voices that makes up modern Britain gets the once-in-a-lifetime chance to sing for the King and Queen Consort at the Coronation Concert, as well as millions watching around the world

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts, as comedian Maisie Adam and journalist Helen Lewis join in the fun on the satirical current affairs quiz, alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: Ordinary frontline police community support officers Dom and Kay are tasked to infiltrate a predominantly black gang of villains. Working undercover, the pair are unwittingly thrust into the murky world of deep cover infiltration as they pose as disgruntled former officers within a powerful criminal enterprise, with the motiviations of the DI who sent them in becoming increasingly unclear. Matters take an unexpected turn when the duo are tasked by a gang member with carrying out a grisly task that throws the mission - and their lives - into chaos. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun

programme.title: Guardians of the Galaxy (2014)
programme.desc: A boy abducted by aliens grows up to be an interstellar mercenary. He and a band of misfits break out of a prison space station with a plan to sell a mysterious orb to the highest bidder - but cross a warlord, who intends to turn it into a powerful weapon. Sci-fi adventure, starring Chris Pratt, Zoe Saldana and Dave Bautista, with the voices of Bradley Cooper and Vin Diesel

programme.title: Guardians of the Galaxy (2014)
programme.desc: A boy abducted by aliens grows up to be an interstellar mercenary. He and a band of misfits break out of a prison space station with a plan to sell a mysterious orb to the highest bidder - but cross a warlord, who intends to turn it into a powerful weapon. Sci-fi adventure, starring Chris Pratt, Zoe Saldana and Dave Bautista, with the voices of Bradley Cooper and Vin Diesel

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents the run-up to the historic occasion from a studio outside Buckingham Palace, where she is joined by a range of guests including friends and colleagues of the royal couple. Throughout the morning, a series of films explore the King's passions, while across the capital a team of presenters are in key locations to report and commentate on the day as events unfold. JJ Chalmers speaks to the men and women of the armed forces as they take their positions, Anita Rani meets members of the public and Sophie Raworth is outside Westminster Abbey

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: Kirsty Young presents live coverage of the historic event as crowds gather to celebrate the Coronation of Charles III and the Queen Consort. Viewers will have a front-row seat of the King's Procession makes it way through the streets of London, from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Abbey, where Sophie Raworth speaks to guests as they arrive and Huw Edwards provides commentary on the ancient ceremony itself

programme.title: The Coronation of HM the King
programme.desc: The pageantry continues as the newly crowned King Charles and Queen Camilla head back to Buckingham Palace in the Coronation Procession, where they are received at the Mall and make their traditional balcony appearance. Presented by Sophie Raworth, with commentary by Huw Edwards

programme.title: Tangled (2010)
programme.desc: A baby princess's hair has mystical powers, so an evil witch kidnaps her and locks her in a tower, hoping to use the magic to fend off old age. When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight. Disney animated comedy based on the Rapunzel story, with the voices of Mandy Moore and Zachary Levi

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Steven Fletcher and Kirsten Ramsay restore a 19th-century clock, George Blackman rebuilds a broken typewriter and Suzie Fletcher repairs a Second World War pilot's bomber jacket

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.desc: Britain is experiencing the largest fall in living standards since records began almost 70 years ago, with the rising cost of everyday essentials - such as food and household bills - thought to have pushed many into poverty. programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are called away from a team-building exercise to investigate a fatal explosion at a haulage yard in Calham Cross. The property is owned by Territorial Army commanding officer Matt Parkes, the father of a businessman whose ruthlessness in the boardroom is matched only by his behaviour toward women. To complicate matters, the village is also home to a peace protester and a grieving mother - and Barnaby has to decide if any of these locals is capable of arson and murder. John Nettles and Jason Hughes star, with Tim Pigott-Smith, Joseph Millson, Niamh Cusack, Judy Parfitt and Nick Fletcher

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby's secret past as a spy is revealed when a former agent is killed after a cricket match between the villagers and the gentry. The dead man's wounds appear to have been inflicted by a giant claw, triggering rumours of a 'beast of Midsomer', and before long, another body turns up with similar injuries. Barnaby then realises the incidents are linked to the time the local network of spies spent in Cold War Berlin. John Nettles and Jason Hughes star, with guest appearances by Anna Massey, Peter Davison and Neil Stuke

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

As the investigation begins, Barnaby has no shortage of suspects, including the victim's recently jilted partner - a teacher whose classroom is full of paintings of the story - his teenage lover, a caretaker and a hotel owner. But the case takes a twist when the killer strikes again amid the chaos of the annual fancy-dress boat race. Detective drama, guest starring Jesse Birdsall and Olivia Colman, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A burglar dubbed 'the Creeper' targets the villages of Midsomer as Barnaby and Jones investigate the murder of a guest at an upper-crust dinner party. As the case progresses, Barnaby becomes the thief's latest victim and it emerges that several high-society friends with connections to gangsters and a police chief have a few secrets worth killing for. Detective drama, starring John Nettles and Jason Hughes, with guest appearances from Rik Mayall and Jenny Agutter

programme.title: Kate & Koji
programme.desc: Koji has an unpleasant experience which Kate tries to put right, with the aid of a gun from the Second World War. Comedy, starring Brenda Blethyn and Okorie Chukwu

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Called to the home of an elderly couple who haven't been seen for a while, Janet discovers Eunice Bevan's severed head at the bottom of the stairs, her body at the top, and her husband Joe in bed, emaciated and barely able to speak. Meanwhile, the detective puts her house on the market, admitting her relationship with Ade is over, and three months in to Rachel's marriage to traffic cop Sean, she's starting to feel a little claustrophobic. programme.title: The Professionals

programme.title: Minder

In Almera, mother-and-son team Sharon and Shaun Garner are poised to help Sue and Don find their dream holiday home for their budget of 140,000 euros. The couple want to get as much bang for their buck as possible in their preferred location of Los Gallardos

Crime comedy, starring Allan Mustafa, Tom Davis, Emer Kenny and Steve Stamp

programme.title: The Curse
programme.desc: All hell breaks loose as the gang members become front page news. Their new life in Spain is under threat and drastic action is needed. However, it's not long before they pass the point of no return. Crime comedy, starring Allan Mustafa, Tom Davis, Emer Kenny and Steve Stamp star

Discovering his cell phone has been left in the box with him, he uses this fragile link to the outside world to try to get help - but his supply of air is running low and even he does not know where he is. Thriller, starring Ryan Reynolds

He spends time with Koreans born and raised in Japan who have their own unique schooling system, complete with portraits of North Korean leaders in every classroom. In Kyoto, Japan's cultural capital, Secunder gains rare access to a grouping known as the Chongryon, a powerful residents association with strong links to the North Korean regime

Meanwhile in California, Harry and Meghan are finally free of Windsor family politics to concentrate on their simple life. But can they really afford to miss the crowning moment?

Frankie looks back to the reigns of six key monarchs who not only had huge influence in their day, but still live long in our collective memory - and finds troubling connections between their grim past and the present

In the early hours of the morning, two elderly men are found semi-conscious with head injuries in the middle of a darkened stretch of road in Leyland, Lancashire. Police escalate their transfer to Preston Royal Hospital, but one of the men's conditions worsens and he dies. The surviving man has no memory of events, so it is up to the coroner to establish what happened that night, and determine the cause of death

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: In Huddersfield, officers are in pursuit of a van driver who smashed his van into a parked car before fleeing, while Bob and Dan pepper spray a suspect who is not keen on being handcuffed. programme.title: Secret Scotland with Susan Calman
programme.desc: The comedian traverses the North Coast 500, a 500-mile trip around the northernmost parts of mainland Britain. Beginning in the village of Golspie, Susan travels round the coast to Dunrobin Castle. There, she sees the 189-room property's clock tower inspired by Big Ben, as well as its very own private train station. Further up the coast, Susan visits the Whaligoe steps, stunningly carved into the dramatic landscape, before getting a taste of the work of a real-life 'herring girl'. After stopping off at John O' Groats, the presenter heads to Dunnet Head for a spot of puffin-watching

programme.title: The Funny Thing About
programme.desc: Johnny Vegas presents a whistle-stop tour of awkward, embarrassing and cringeworthy holiday moments, as related by a selection of comedians and celebrities. Johnny's famous contributors skewer the traditional staycation, questioning the perks of rain-drenched British beaches, and whether anyone really likes going camping. Turning their attention further afield, the stars share some of their most memorable holiday tales, including transforming a hotel corridor into one long 'slip-and-slide', the suspicious discovery of a pair of chicken fillets in a swimming pool in Marbella, and a blush-inducing incident involving a naked paragliding session along a Spanish beachfront

programme.title: The Dam Busters (1955)
programme.desc: The story of the destruction of the major dams in Germany's industrial heartland in the Ruhr valley in 1943, a mission that seemed impossible until engineer and scientist Barnes Wallis came up with the ingenious idea of bouncing bombs, and the pilots of 617 Squadron were trained to fly the crucial mission. Second World War drama, with Michael Redgrave, Richard Todd, Basil Sydney, Derek Farr and Ursula Jeans

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Comedy Classics: Porridge
programme.desc: A tribute to Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais's prison-based sitcom Porridge. This documentary examines how the characters in Slade Prison revolved around Fletch, Ronnie Barker's inimitable creation. As well as those laugh-out-loud moments from the three series, there's a look at 1978 spin-off Going Straight, Porridge: The Movie, US remake On the Rocks, and the 2017 reboot starring Kevin Bishop and Ricky Grover

programme.title: Fawlty Towers: 50 Years of Laughs
programme.desc: A celebration of John Cleese and Connie Booth's acclaimed sitcom following the misadventures of Torquay hotel owner Basil Fawlty. The programme explores its phenomenal success, with a selection of its finest moments, and contributions from fans, experts and supporting cast members

programme.title: When... Goes Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: Jonathan Pearce narrates a selection of edge-of-the-seat stunts from around the globe, including terrifying car smashes, stomach-churning base jumps and weird and wonderful world record attempts. Those featured include Jackass star Steve-O, whose attempt at jumping over a moving car on a skateboard left him hospitalised, inventor Colin Furze, who recalls the time his Wall of Death ended in disaster, and Hollywood stuntman Mike Gaboff, who reflects on how jumping a lake on his motorbike while on fire spelled the end of his career

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Secret Scotland with Susan Calman
programme.desc: As her journey around her homeland continues, Susan visits the Isle of Skye, where she embarks on an exclusive tour of Dunvegan Castle, which has been home to the McLeods for over 800 years. There, she learns all about clan warfare and discovers a ceremonial horn that has been passed down through generations of clan chiefs since the 14th century. Next, the comedian takes to the seas to operate the world's only turntable ferry, before trying her hand at the accordion. Finally, Susan gains an insight into the workings of a modern-day croft and finds out how to shear a sheep

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross reminisces with Rachel about the good times they had when they were dating, as the invitations go out for his wedding. Meanwhile, the others work out whether they can attend the ceremony. Comedy, starring David Schwimmer and Jennifer Aniston

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Part two of two. As everyone makes their final preparations for Ross's wedding in London, Rachel tries to get a flight out to declare her love for him before he marries Emily. Guest starring Jennifer Saunders, Elliott Gould, Hugh Laurie and Tom Conti
